name: pneumobilia
description: Pneumobilia refers to the presence of air within the biliary tree, typically observed as linear or branching lucencies within the hepatic ducts or common bile duct on imaging studies such as X-rays, CT scans, or MRIs.

attributes.name: presence
attributes.description: This indicates whether pneumobilia is present.

values.name: absent
values.description: It indicates no pneumobilia is present.

values.name: present
values.description: It signifies that pneumobilia is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: It suggests that it cannot be determined whether pneumobilia is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It represents uncertainty regarding the presence of pneumobilia.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: This indicates the anatomical region of the pneumobilia.
